entry.title: Madras Bhai Biriyani not so good

link.title: Madras Bhai Biriyani not so good

entry.content:
I had to meet a friend in Velacherry, I went there it was on a Saturday. For me food is everything, so we need to have biriyani. We ventured into a place called Madras Bhai Biriyani. When we enetered the smell was good, and there was a muslim serving biriyani. When queried he said there was hydrabadi biriyani and vaniyambadi biriyani. I went for hydrabadi.

Thankfully this hydrabai was not like:

Looks like hydrabadi’s like to get the feel of 5-star hotels while eating biriyani. In 5-star hotel if you order coffee, you get milk, decoction, sugar, and you must mix them and make your own coffee. Similarly when you order hydrabadi biriyani, you will get rice, masala and meat pieces which you must mix. It’s a kind of way we Tamils hate. I was expecting biiyani to be like that, but it was given to me well mixed in Tamil way. I was thankful for that.

The taste was okay, the brinjal gravy was excellent, actually without the gravy of brinjal the biriyani was not so good. One thing that irked me was, when you pressed the chicken piece, something watery came out. I am not here to make judgement or demonize that place, but there was a heavy feeling after eating the biriyani, apart from that I did not face any health condition.

So my verdict on Madras Bhai Biriyani is: not so good. If you are using old Chicken, please don’t do stuff like that. It’s bad.

They might cheat

My friend and his wife are vegetarians. This Madras Bhai Biriyani and other shops share the eating spot, so they ordered vegetable fried rice, the server brought them egg fried rice, when they spotted the egg which was obvious and all over the rice, that guy said it was paneer. What? That’s a lie, lie lie liar.

So biriyani is not so good, neighboring shop cheats. Not a good place.

Butterscotch?

In that same place there was an ice cream shop, I ordered butterscotch, what I got was something like vanilla mixed with some stuff, and it was given in a waffle whose dimension was like a small tea cup, and for that they charged Rs 100/- . i couldn’t believe it.

Final word

  • They might be using old products
  • They are not accurate, do wrong things and tell lies so that it will be covered
  • Their rates are high

Should you go there?

entry.title: The problem of being a good Ruby on Rails developer

link.title: The problem of being a good Ruby on Rails developer

entry.content:
For some reason I listen to keynote speech of Matz, DHH, and Aaron Patterson. I feel what they talk makes sense to me, that too Matz future ideas about programming, and how computers should serve humans and not the other way around, DHH’s idea of making Ruby on Rails so powerful that individual persons can challenge a big corporate employing tens of people coding a web app. these are powerful ideas. Aaron Patterson’s work of making Ruby as well as Rails faster and better. These all makes sense to me.

I also felt what decisions what were made to Rails were very sensible except these two:

  1. Getting rid of Coffeescript.
  2. Using Webpacker.

I still don’t get what webpacker is. Thanks to Rails 7 we have got rid of it. I am coding in Rails since it was 2.x and it has given me a excellent experience. Even today if I touch legacy code of my former teams, I can understand the code and make changes in an easy way. As far as I know, none who has inherited code from me has reported a problem to me. The reason for that is very simple, Rails follows a convention, and I follow it religiously. Rails is a philosophy which has many best practices, and I stick to it. This however does not mean that changing double quotes to single quotes because shitty Rubocop yells at you. Doing such things is stupid. But I have to admit in project dominated by fools, I did follow Rubocop.

But then what happens when you are a good, stick to the principle Ruby on Rails developer. For example what will happen if you are a honest India government servant? You won’t take bribes, and you will find t too difficult to fit in India. So what will happen to a Ruby on Rails developer when he is in a project that violates lot of rules laid by Ruby on Rails. It becomes difficult for you, making modifications to it becomes a pain. You start to wonder why people picked up Ruby on Rails if they don’t want to follow it.

When you get experienced, when you become Architect of tech, Principal Engineer just by your age (I have seen no intelligence increase in a architect compared to novice), people hire you not because they want you to maintain a good project or want to start a green field project, they hire you because they really screwed up with Rails and want some one with age and experience to solve it. It’s like telling a bank manager to work with thieves. Thieves knows crappy way of doing things, the bank manager however sees perfection in system, understands economics and don’t want to loot because he understands economics.

Note: When I say bank, I don’t means real banks of today which loot us, I mean a ideal bank and ideal bank manager in a dream world. Today a thief admits he loots us, a bank does not.

So being a person who does not mess up Rails framework because you are sane, you need to work with insane people who have truly messed it up. That’s a great problem for a Ruby on Rails purist.

entry.title: Fundamentals of a Business
entry.content:
I was talking with my friend who wanted to have his own business. I soon found out that he wanted to have a business to get rich, to leave something for his kids, which means his business has failed even before it materialized. He never talked about the three main things which I think is essential for a business.

In this blog I want to write what qualities I think are fundamental for a business, what qualities I think that will make it successful.

Value

The first fundamental thing is value. Some one wants to buy your product or service only if they think it’s valuable, or else they have to be a fool to invest money. No matter how ever less value it is, your business must add value.

For example I was consulting for a company called DataMaking, our team size grew a lot, we had to do something to keep meeting times low, so we developed a tool doneit. It reduced our meeting times. After it worked for us, we told our friends to try, gave them free trials and some of them became paid subscribers.

There was some value for a tool creation, we could identify it and so we created it. It later became a business.

Honesty

Honesty is necessary for business. Say you have a bank backing you, they want to know how your business will go so that they can predict the future and make sure there is enough funds available to the creditors. If you are dishonest, they will not be able to help you in the long run and will loose trust in you.

If you are not honest about the product or service you are selling to someone, people will loose trust in it. For example almost no startups use Oracle, no programmer uses Windows. People have lost trust in them.

Equality

Today SpaceX is doing real magic in space industry, but I don’t think it will be successful in the long run. Elon Musk treats people like shit, does not value dissent. Business is for people and by people. If one does not recognize the equality of people, a business is doomed to fail in the long run.

Once a business crosses 3 workers, the owner of the business has no real control of it, he has to consult people to take next decision, it becomes more of a democratic process. If a worker in a business doesn’t like it, crack will appear, will widen, and the business will fail.

It is the responsibility of people who say that they can run a business to make sure all have equal stake in the business.
entry.summary: I was talking with my friend who wanted to have his own business. I soon found out that he wanted to have a business to get rich, to leave something for his kids, which means his business has failed even before it materialized. He never talked about the three main things which I think is essential for a business.
